image.altText: An aerial shot of a large multi-storey hospital with a glass and concrete split level facade.

props.synopsis: FOI documents obtained by the ABC reveal staff raised concerns that no move date had been given for the new Footscray Hospital opening months before the state government announced delays.

title.children: Staff express 'lack of clarity' concerns over Footscray Hospital opening

image.altText: A police officer with their head and face covered holds a gun beside a plain clothes officer outside a house with police tape.

props.synopsis: Heavily armed police swarm a house in Melbourne's south-east after the bodies of the man and woman were discovered.

title.children: Man arrested at railway station after two found dead in Mount Waverley

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: More Victorians died of drug overdoses in 2024 compared to any other year in the past decade, a new Coroners Court of Victoria report shows, with a 16 per cent increase in deaths since 2015.

title.children: Victoria records highest number of fatal overdoses in a decade

image.altText: An illustration of a young boy staring at a computer. He is surrounded by text bubbles.

props.synopsis: An investigation by triple j hack uncovers allegations of young people in Australia being sexually harassed and even encouraged to take their own life by AI chatbots.

title.children: AI chatbots accused of encouraging teen suicide as experts sound alarm

image.altText: A man with short dark hair wearing black sunglasses and a black top holds a red AFL football on a film set.

props.synopsis: The international hip-hop artist has been announced as the pre-game entertainment for the 2025 AFL grand final.

title.children: Rapper Snoop Dogg to entertain MCG crowd at the AFL grand final

image.altText: A narrow river runs through the centre of the image, on either side is a thick blanket of river red gum trees.

props.synopsis: Irrigators from New South Wales and Victoria allege the Murray-Darling Basin Authority mismanaged water between 2017 and 2019, costing them more than $1 billion in losses.

title.children: Class action alleges water authority cost 28,000 irrigators millions

image.altText: A palm tree growing dates in a dry orchard

props.synopsis: Dates are a niche industry in Australia, but the growers' association hopes the promise of a lucrative export market and a unique geographical position could make it an appealing one.

title.children: Date industry looking for growers keen to capture 'seller's market'

image.altText: Max Gawn celebrates with Melbourne teammates

props.synopsis: Melbourne currently has no senior coach and sits 13th on the ladder, but Paul Roos believes the club could have a quick turnaround next season.

title.children: Roos declares Melbourne 'could win a flag next year' amid coach hunt

image.altText: A man looks very serious wearing a blue football polo shirt.

props.synopsis: Adam Simpson becomes the latest high-profile candidate to rule himself out of coaching Melbourne next season after Simon Goodwin's sacking.

title.children: Simpson 'not in the right headspace' to join Melbourne coaching race

image.altText: Jim Shen stands at the edge of the indoor pool with a pink towel around his neck.

props.synopsis: Heating Australia's beloved aquatic centres comes at a cost to the environment. With centres accounting for more than 50 per cent of some councils' annual emissions, it's putting local government net-zero targets at risk.

title.children: Heated public pools threaten Victorian councils' net-zero targets

image.altText: A man in a baseball cap and black T-shirt smiles at a camera.

props.synopsis: An anti-sexual violence campaigner condemns what she says is an inadequate fine for a former footballer who secretly filmed a sex act.

title.children: Women condemn fine for man who secretly filmed sex act

image.altText: A black and white photo of a horse behind a gate in a paddock with a shooting star in the top left hand corner of the shot.

props.synopsis: The meteor was seen across Victoria just after 7:30pm on Sunday, with some observers describing a large, bright object and a loud boom.

title.children: 'Thought it was a plane crash': Meteor shakes houses across Victoria

image.altText: A paramedic stands near a strecher beside an ambulance and a police car parked out the front of a brown brick house at night.

props.synopsis: The 50-year-old has been hospitalised in a serious condition after he was allegedly stabbed by a burglar who police say assaulted his elderly father in Melbourne's west.

title.children: Man stabbed multiple times trying to help 84yo father in home invasion

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man with dark hair, in a black jacket and checked shirt holding a sign with his name on it.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police have launched a new plea for information in relation to George Karakis, who they say failed to appear in court in 1974 after being charged with breaking into a home and assaulting a woman.

title.children: Fresh appeal to find man charged with rape in Fitzroy 50 years ago

props.synopsis: Despite two poor seasons, climate-change worries and growing competition from Japan and New Zealand, Australian alpine businesses are making substantial investments that signal a firm belief in the future of our winter wonderlands.

title.children: Mega-investment signals fierce belief in Australia's snow business

image.altText: a baby boy looking into the camera, a towel loosely covering the top of his head and back

props.synopsis: Family day care makes up just 5 per cent of Australia's early childhood education and care system, but insiders, experts and regulatory documents paint a picture of a sector beset by troubling incidents and structural risk.

title.children: Parents of boy who died in family day care urge authorities to 'wake up'

image.altText: a teenage girl with long blonde hair and her mother who had dark brown hair, standing cheek to cheek and smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Polycystic ovary syndrome affects between 6 and 13 per cent of women, but its name has been labelled misleading. An Australian-led initiative is pushing for a global change.

title.children: PCOS sufferers call for 'misleading' name to be changed

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and glasses holds up a strip of text in gloved hands

props.synopsis: A 4,000-year-old tax receipt is among the treasures on display at the State Library of Victoria's annual World of the Book exhibition, celebrating its 20th anniversary in 2025.

title.children: Ancient texts reveal the remarkable 4,000-year 'global history' of books

image.altText: Miranda, Picnic at Hanging Rock

props.synopsis: Australia’s national identity rests on silences and erasures. Like the missing schoolgirls, the colonial subject is lost, unsure of who belongs and whose history matters.

title.children: Picnic at Hanging Rock is just as unsettling and relevant 50 years on

image.altText: A man looks very serious wearing a blue football polo shirt.

props.synopsis: Adam Simpson becomes the latest high-profile candidate to rule himself out of coaching Melbourne next season after Simon Goodwin's sacking.

title.children: Simpson 'not in the right headspace' to join Melbourne coaching race

image.altText: Daniel Hoogstra looks seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: Western United fans have expressed their disappointment and sadness after the team was stripped of its A-League licence late last week.

title.children: Western United fans 'disappointed' after A-League licence withdrawal

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and glasses holds up one hand as he speaks.

props.synopsis: Strengthening self-defence laws would give Victorians "peace of mind" in the face of a rise in home invasions, according to a crossbench MP. But the government has defended existing laws while urging people to call police in an emergency.

title.children: Call for overhaul of Victoria's self-defence laws as home invasions spike

image.altText: Woman passing non binary poerson a take away coffee out the front of a country cafe.

props.synopsis: Bobbi is a transgender woman who lived her first 60 years in the US where she worked as a NASA engineer. But with her home state of Florida increasingly hostile she's found solace in regional Victoria.

title.children: From NASA to Rupanyup, trans woman flees the US and finds her haven

image.altText: A white lighthouse with red roof near cliffs of a rocky coast at sunset.

props.synopsis: The south-western Victorian shire withdraws from a tourism promotion board, saying it is not getting "bang for buck" and is routinely overlooked.

title.children: Glenelg gives up bid to be part of global Great Ocean Road tourism brand

image.altText: A large truck on its side. It is on fire.

props.synopsis: Large plumes of thick, black smoke are visible in western Victoria after an accident involving two B-double trucks on the Western Highway.

title.children: Section of Western Highway closed after accident involving two trucks

image.altText: A video on TikTok shows a large group of men dressed in black, carrying placards and flags, and chanting.

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan says "Nazis", "goons" will not be tolerated after about 100 people marched through Melbourne dressed in black and chanting.

title.children: 'Not afraid of these goons': Premier reacts after Melbourne 'Nazi' march

image.altText: A young woman with long black hair holds a baby girl in her arms standing in a kitchen

props.synopsis: Women who have spent years navigating the health system seeking care for extreme pain say they are frustrated at the slow pace of a government inquiry into the issue.

title.children: 'It's not right': Frustration as Australian-first women's pain inquiry in limbo

image.altText: A woman standing in front of her car.

props.synopsis: Police alleged Erin Patterson had poisoned her husband Simon several times, before she served his parents and aunt a beef Wellington lunch containing death cap mushrooms.

title.children: Erin Patterson denied poisoning husband using toxic pasta and chicken curry

image.altText: Woman with short bright blue hair, and glasses sits smiling, a framed photo portrait of her hangs in the background.

props.synopsis: Ballarat artists share their story with the community, sparking positive conversations about disability and inspiring others to be unapologetically themselves.

title.children: Disability pride is about not having to 'apologise over and over'

image.altText: Cast of five performers standing on stage.

props.synopsis: A critically acclaimed Australian stage adaptation of George Orwell's novel 1984 attracts full houses as it tours across the nation.

title.children: Dystopian George Orwell classic 1984 finds new audience on stage

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police are still searching for the man behind an alleged carjacking in a school car park near Geelong, south-west of Melbourne on Wednesday.

title.children: Pair charged following alleged carjacking in school car park near Geelong

image.altText: A multi-storey building with arch windows and pink bricks and a Mecca sign on the front.

props.synopsis: About 20,000 people are expected to rush through the doors of cosmetic giant Mecca's new store on its opening day. But is the hype enough to revive Melbourne's hushed CBD after the pandemic?

title.children: The opening of a megastore reflects the revival of retail in Melbourne's CBD

image.altText: noni Hazlehurst, with fair long hair and fringe, sits near a front bar at a pub, smiling with closed mouth.

props.synopsis: After the huge success of her first one-woman show, Mother, Noni Hazlehurst sits down with ABC Arts to speak frankly about her new show and the powerful publican at the centre of it.

title.children: Noni Hazlehurst's latest show will make you leave your judgements at the door

image.altText: James Tomkins drapped in the Australian flag, in front of the Olympic rings, looking over his right shoulder

props.synopsis: A Victorian study has found elite male rowers are seven times more likely to develop atrial fibrillation, a common heart rhythm disorder associated with increased risk of stroke.

title.children: Elite male rowers seven times more likely to develop heart disorder, study finds

image.altText: Three Dockers AFL players celebrate a goal.

props.synopsis: Fremantle is refusing to get carried away with its last-gasp win over Port Adelaide, as it moves into the AFL top four ahead of the finals.

title.children: Top-four Dockers warned not to 'get caught up in the noise'
